page.title: 10LOCAL ROADS
page.content: Most other roads in this area are small, little more than country lanes with passing places. They carry local transport often taking them as a short cut. One such road linking the A5 and A6 carries heavier local traffic since not only is it a link road but it also serves the Golf Club and riding stables. A traffic count on this road for half an hour during the afternoon of the Spring Bank holiday showed that a total of 39 vehicles used this road and all but 10 of them were going to or from the golf course or riding stables. In the south_west corner of our area is the beginning of the Redbourn bypass. This was opened in 1984 to ease traffic flow on the A5 through Redbourn.
